intro: Bowiea volubilis subsp. gariepensis, commonly known as the Gariep moonvine, is a climbing plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and squash. The plant is characterized by its long, trailing stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow and appear in clusters, followed by orange or red fruits that split open to reveal seeds. This species is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
